title: Casting News: Deborah Norville Exits Inside Edition, Days of Our Lives Departure and More
description: Deborah Norville is saying goodbye to Inside Edition after 30 years as anchor of the syndicated newsmagazine. Norville announced her exit during this Wednesday’s episode, revealing that her tenure at Inside Edition, which she joined in 1995, will conclude at the end of this season. “They made me a lovely offer to stay, but there […]
author: Vlada Gelman
excerpt: Deborah Norville is exiting 'Inside Edition' after 30 years as anchor of the syndicated newsmagazine — watch her make the announcement.
text: Deborah Norville is saying goodbye to Inside Edition after 30 years as anchor of the syndicated newsmagazine. Norville announced her exit during this Wednesday’s episode, revealing that her tenure at Inside Edition, which she joined in 1995, will conclude at the end of this season. “They made me a lovely offer to stay, but there are things I’d like to do and places I want to do them that continuing here doesn’t permit,” Norville explained, adding that she has “some exciting things in the works,” which she’ll share later. “But what I want to say now is what a privilege it’s been to lead Inside Edition for all these years,” Norville continued. “To work with the incredibly talented team here, and to be invited into your homes every day, it’s an honor I don’t take lightly.” In other recent casting news… * Tamara Braun’s last episode of Days of Our Lives will air this Thursday, April 3, the actress, who played Ava Vitali, announced on Instagram. “Sad but true. I’ve been gone since late July of last year but you can still catch Ava on your screens until April 3rd!” Braun wrote. “I miss being with my Days pals. They are a really good group of caring individuals and being with them was a joy.” * Anthony Edwards (ER) and J. Smith-Cameron (Succession) have joined the FX drama pilot Seven Sisters, playing father and mother to Elizabeth Olsen and Cristin Milioti’s characters, our sister site Deadline reports. * William Fichtner (Prison Break) and Eric Lange (Sugar, Perry Mason) will recur in the Apple TV+ limited series Lucky, starring Anya Taylor-Joy, per Deadline. * Comedian/podcast host Jake Shane will play Social Media Girlie in Hacks’ upcoming fourth season (premiering April 10 on Max), our sister site Variety reports. Hit the comments with your thoughts on the above castings!
html:
Deborah Norville is saying goodbye to Inside Edition after 30 years as anchor of the syndicated newsmagazine.

Norville announced her exit during this Wednesday’s episode, revealing that her tenure at Inside Edition, which she joined in 1995, will conclude at the end of this season.

“They made me a lovely offer to stay, but there are things I’d like to do and places I want to do them that continuing here doesn’t permit,” Norville explained, adding that she has “some exciting things in the works,” which she’ll share later.

“But what I want to say now is what a privilege it’s been to lead Inside Edition for all these years,” Norville continued. “To work with the incredibly talented team here, and to be invited into your homes every day, it’s an honor I don’t take lightly.”

In other recent casting news…

* Tamara Braun’s last episode of Days of Our Lives will air this Thursday, April 3, the actress, who played Ava Vitali, announced on Instagram. “Sad but true. I’ve been gone since late July of last year but you can still catch Ava on your screens until April 3rd!” Braun wrote. “I miss being with my Days pals. They are a really good group of caring individuals and being with them was a joy.”

* Anthony Edwards (ER) and J. Smith-Cameron (Succession) have joined the FX drama pilot Seven Sisters, playing father and mother to Elizabeth Olsen and Cristin Milioti’s characters, our sister site Deadline reports.

* William Fichtner (Prison Break) and Eric Lange (Sugar, Perry Mason) will recur in the Apple TV+ limited series Lucky, starring Anya Taylor-Joy, per Deadline.

* Comedian/podcast host Jake Shane will play Social Media Girlie in Hacks’ upcoming fourth season (premiering April 10 on Max), our sister site Variety reports.

Hit the comments with your thoughts on the above castings!
